item.title: Transactions Isolation #1: Dirty Read
item.description: Transaction is an atomic unit of work, sometimes made up of multiple operations. When a transaction makes multiple changes to the database, either all the changes succeed when the transaction is committed, or all the changes are undone when the transaction is rolled-back. Transactions don’t socialize Isolation is the ‘I’ in ACID (a set of properties of a database transactions intend to guarantee data validity) It ensures that concurrent execution of transactions will obtain the same state that would have been obtained if the transactions were executed sequentially.
